title: After Peloton's $8bn market debut, what's next for the fitness technology industry?
text:
My trainer, Lawrence, is taking me through a new routine, dipping low into a squat jump and up again. “Keep those reps up!”

This is not a normal living room workout or an outdated fitness DVD. A heartbeat tracker, strapped to my chest, pips along to my propress. My calorie burn appears on screen, and reps count up as a notification on the TV screams: “New personal best!” My smartphone tabulates the data and ranks my performance.

Fitness technology promises to be the next big boom for start-ups as they muscle into the $40bn (£32bn) global fitness market. In the first six months of the year, fitness technology start-ups raised an estimated $1.3bn, according to analyst firm CB Insights.
